class.title: Principles of Accounting I
class.description: If enrolling in this course, you must have access to the Internet, e-mail and Microsoft Office software (97 or later version), including Word and Excel. Final exam must be taken at an approved proctored testing site. Go to http://ecampus.dcccd.edu and follow the login procedures to access the course. Use your seven-digit student I.D. number as both the username and password. For more information, contact Clarice McCoy at clariceMccoy@dcccd.edu or 972-860-4166.

class.title: Art Appreciation
class.description: These online Art Appreciation classes will utilize a textbook, PowerPoint presentations, online searches and virtual visits to museums around the world. For additional information, please contact Cynthia Mills at 972-860-4734 or e-mail cMills@dcccd.edu.

class.title: Survey Art History
class.description: This course covers the history of Western Art from Prehistoric time through the Gothic period. It explores the cultural, geophysical and personal influences on art styles.
class.alt-description: This course covers the history of Western Art from Prehistoric time through the Gothic period. It explores the cultural, geophysical and personal influences on art styles.

class.title: 2D Design
class.description: Basic concepts of design with two-dimensional materials are explored. The use of line, color, illusion of space or mass, texture, shape and size in composition is considered.
class.alt-description: Basic concepts of design with two-dimensional materials are explored. The use of line, color, illusion of space or mass, texture, shape and size in composition is considered.

class.title: Advanced Metals/Jewelry I
class.alt-description: An intensive 11-day workshop in "Color on Metal" with visiting artist Frankie Flood, May 12-27, M-F. 9 a.m. - 5 p.m. For additional information please contact Susan Mollet at 972-860-4138.

class.title: Creative Photo Arts I
class.alt-description: An intensive 11-day workshop in photopolymer photogravure printing with visiting artist, Deborah Riley, June 9-23, M-F, 9 a.m.-5 p.m. For more information, please call David Newman at 972-860-4101.

class.alt-description: This is an intensive, 11-day workshop in woodcut with visiting artist Tom Huck. Classes meet Fri, May 9, M-F, May 12-23, 9 a.m.-5 p.m. For additional information, please call Don Taylor at 972-860-4732.

class.alt-description: Intensive all-media Figure Drawing Workshop with guest artist and master teacher John Lincoln, hosted in the two-story drawing studio at SMU. All levels of experience with drawing the figure are welcome. Please e-mail Lianne@dcccd.edu for more information.

class.title: Biology for Science Majors I
class.alt-description: Biology 1406 is a course for students majoring and/or minoring in Biology or related disciplines. It is recommended that students have recently had either high school biology or Biology 1408 or 1409. It is also recommended that students have recently had high school chemistry or Chemistry 1405 before taking this course.

Lectures, labs, most assignments, tests and quizzes are online, however, a midterm exam, lab practicals 1 and 2 and the final exam will be taken in the Testing Center or a pre-arranged alternate site.

class.title: Directed Studies
class.description: DIRS 9170 is a three week course designed to give students the study skills and background to successfully complete SCIT 1407 and SCIT 1408, Anatomy and Physiology 1 and 2. Students who should take this course include those with limited background in biology and chemistry, who have been out of school for an extended period of time, or who desire an overview of Anatomy and Physiology.

class.title: Earth Science
class.description: Recap: Friday, 5:30-10 p.m., Saturday, 9 a.m.-4:30 p.m., Sunday, 9 a.m.-3:30 p.m., PLUS ONE MANDITORY MONDAY (JUNE 30 ONLY) 5:30 p.m.-10 p.m. FOR FINAL EXAM. Must attend all sessions. This class will visit Hot Springs National Park in Arkansas the weekend of June 20 - 22. A ranger's tour of Bathhouse Row, quartz crystal collecting and a geo-float trip on Lake Ouachita will be included. Approximate cost is $100/student plus gasoline. For more information call 972-860-4713.

class.title: Web Des I
class.description: This class is taught online with an online orientation. The focus is on designing standard compliant Web sites for the Internet using HTML, XHTML and CSS, as well as creating and preparing graphics for use on Web pages. Requires access to the Internet using a current browser (not AOL), e-mail, Dreamweaver and Photoshop software for your particular operating system. IMED 1416 replaces IMED 1316 in the Visual Communications degree plans beginning this summer 2008 semester. Questions? Call Lauri Collins at 972-860-4308, e-mail LCollins@dcccd.edu or visit http://telecollege.dcccd.edu.

course.title: Spc Tpc/Cmptr/Info Science,gen
course.long-title: Special Topics in Computer and Information Sciences, General

class.title: Beginning Keyboard
class.description: ITSC 1191 covers touch typing including the alphabet, number and symbol keys. Textbook with specialized software is required.
class.alt-description: ITSC 1191 covers touch typing including the alphabet, number and symbol keys. Textbook with specialized software is required.

class.title: Legacy Family Tree II
class.description: This course is a continuation of the Legacy Family Tree beginning course. Students will learn how to backup and restore Family Files; perform complex searches on Family Files, use advanced tagging and print customized reports; use the source clipboard to record source information; correct mistakes in records in a Family File; and export and import GEDCOMs. Required prerequisite: Legacy Family Tree I.
class.alt-description: This course is a continuation of the Legacy Family Tree beginning course. Students will learn how to backup and restore Family Files; perform complex searches on Family Files, use advanced tagging and print customized reports; use the source clipboard to record source information; correct mistakes in records in a Family File; and export and import GEDCOMs. Required prerequisite: Legacy Family Tree I.

class.title: Legacy Family Tree IV
class.description: Students will bring their Family File to class and enter individuals, events and sources during the class. Tips, tricks and techniques using events, source citations, locations, complex searches and customized reports will be discussed in the class. Required prerequisite: Legacy Family Tree II.
class.alt-description: Students will bring their Family File to class and enter individuals, events and sources during the class. Tips, tricks and techniques using events, source citations, locations, complex searches and customized reports will be discussed in the class. Required prerequisite: Legacy Family Tree II.

class.title: Internet Part I
class.description: Internet Part I is a six-session course covering basic e-mail functions plus attachments. Students will learn to do searches using Google and other search engines. Other topics include addressing Web pages, using instant messenger and shopping/purchasing online. The class will use Microsoft Internet Explorer and also will discuss SBC/Yahoo, AOL and other browsers. Recommended prerequisite: Windows XP.
class.alt-description: Internet Part I is a six-session course covering basic e-mail functions plus attachments. Students will learn to do searches using Google and other search engines. Other topics include addressing Web pages, using instant messenger and shopping/purchasing online. The class will use Microsoft Internet Explorer and also will discuss SBC/Yahoo, AOL and other browsers. Recommended prerequisite: Windows XP.

class.title: VISTA for XP Users
class.description: ITSC 1191-2204 will cover the difference in Windows XP and Windows VISTA, some of the pitfalls/problems between the two operating systems and how to determine if a program that ran on XP has been tested or not tested to run on VISTA POFI 1104. Note: This class is being held at the East Center at the NE corner of Midway and Alpha.
class.alt-description: ITSC 1191-2204 will cover the difference in Windows XP and Windows VISTA, some of the pitfalls/problems between the two operating systems and how to determine if a program that ran on XP has been tested or not tested to run on VISTA POFI 1104. Note: This class is being held at the East Center at the NE corner of Midway and Alpha.

class.title: Digital Camera
class.description: ITSC 1191-2205 will cover the various features of a digital camera. Students will learn about the process of transferring photos to the computer, how to take pictures with an eye for computer enhancement and for use in e-mails and Web pages. Storage and retrieval of digital photos will be reviewed. If you have a camera, please bring it to class.
class.alt-description: ITSC 1191-2205 will cover the various features of a digital camera. Students will learn about the process of transferring photos to the computer, how to take pictures with an eye for computer enhancement and for use in e-mails and Web pages. Storage and retrieval of digital photos will be reviewed. If you have a camera, please bring it to class.

class.title: Medical Terminology
class.description: Medical Terminology requires a computer with access to the Internet and e-mail along with Microsoft 2003 or 2007 software. This course is designed as a hybrid course that includes online instruction, online chapter quizzes, two on-campus exams. Course content is delivered online in PP presentations, threaded discussions, textbook interactive activities, and self assessments found on student's CD included with textbook. NOTE: This course is required prior to taking Med. Coding Basics and Med. Ins. Orientation is online. class.description: A combination course for beginning and intermediate students that utilizes low-impact aerobic warm-ups, poses and calisthenics. This improves flexibility, balance and posture as well as equalizes muscle strength. Focus will be on breathing and relaxation.

class.title: General Physics
class.description: PHYS 1401 is an algebra/trigonometry-based course for pre-dental, pre-pharmacy and pre-architecture majors, and other students who need a two-semester technical course. class.title: Windows XP/Com Basic
class.description: Windows XP focuses on computer literacy and terminology of the Microsoft Windows XP operating system. In this 12-session course, components of personal computers, hardware and software will be taught as well as menu bars, toolbars and shortcuts. You will learn to name, save, locate and print files and also use the word processing program to create, edit and format files.
